Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and lighter painted bands with remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394540) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394540)
